author: A_Brickset_user
title: Gold half-sphere
review: I got mine for the astronaut, computer pieces, levers, and gold half-sphere. The set is hardly useful if kept together. You can attach half-spheres to each other by sticking a technic wedge belt wheel in between the two open ends. If you don't know what that is, look it up on www.peeron.com. It's really cool.

author: mrmitch
title: Cruise the moon in style
review: Cheap set but nicely done. Half gold dome is unique to Space Port sets. I like the mini figure, the set is small and fairly simple to assemble. If your into Space Port a Lunar Rover or two are needed to complete your missoion.

author: Blade
title: Moon Buggy
review:
This Lunar Rover is quite different to most my other space sets as most of them are bases and flying vehicles and for a space vehicle with wheels this one has alot going for it.

The vehicle drives on four medium size tires and is controlled by two leavers. It has a reflective plate at the front, aerial for radio transmissions, lunar lights on the side of the vehicle and a half gold sphere on the back with instrument panel for long range transmissions and identification.

The mini-fig is white in a full space suit, with a gold reflective visor, just like the real astronauts. The face is standard, with a fringe and a headset. The only real flaw of the whole model is the front piece, which is a sticker.

Overall it's a great little model with lots of features and great aesthetics. I'd say this one is a 7/10, could have been more, if the playability was higher. Makes a nice addition to any space collection and adds something for ground vehicles.

author: hustla187
title: Lunar Rover Review
review: I had this set for part time until I sold it to someone. This was a pretty average set. I liked the gold radar piece which is very cool to this day. However, eveything else seems lame. No wonder I sold this set to someone.

author: Calanon
title: My first set (I think)
review: as the title says, I think this was my first lego set ever, one of my first anyway. everything about it is just awsome, buy it if you see it, although it's small it makes up with the great detial and playability!

author: asianlego
title: Bug catcher?
review: This vehicle has a striking resemblance to a bug catching device on wheels. The astronaut minifig is cool. I hated the gold dome at the back as it reminds me of my aunt's hideous earrings. The vehicle is however is okay.

author: buzzandwoody2000
title: One Of My Best Space Port Rovers
review:
This is a great set. I love the gold rader system as a computer life form tracker. It rocks with the other sets of space port.
It has a title as the 3erd best space port set. If you see this set, Buy It to add to your space port.
buzzandwoody2000

author: andy87
title: cute
review: This was a nice space set of 1999, one of the first legos I got hooked on. It rolls very nicley and the gold dome thing is pretty cool to play with. The astronaut is also really cool! I miss the space sets that were awesomely designed like this.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (Space Port) - Lunar Rover Review
review:
This is a great little set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only 2 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 36 pieces and it was 4 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 11 cents per piece which is a nice value for a model like this.

Minifigures

The astronaut comes wh√≠th a white overall, a white helmet, a golden visor and a nice headset on his face.

The build

The build is very fun and easy and we also get one sticker which you need to put on.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6463-1.jpg[/img]


The vehicle has a very nice design. On the back we get a radar which can be adjusted. What I like about the radar is the golden piece we get with this model. On each side of this vehicle is a piece which you can adjust and the piece in the front can sviwel, too. It's a really good set - even if it doesn't do much.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de



Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1

Stopmotion 2

Stopmotion 3

Review

author: AETerry
title: Lunar Rover Review
review:
1999 and I wonder what I was thinking when I picked up this set. Probably that I wanted to buy some Legos and was in the mood to check out some of the new sets.

 

It's a small set, so the price was good and it was fairly quick and easy to build. I am just not really impressed with it. There were new printed pieces and the chrome elements where what I wanted to check out.

 

It's just not a set that sparks my imagination, sense of nostaglia or as a collector and what can I do with it for MOCs.

author: Gog_the_Viking
title: Very Cool, and Compact
review: While not too challenging to build, and rather small, this is a pretty cool little vehicle.  For the cheap price it was sold at, it offers quite a few neat pieces (i.e. the golden half dome, sticker, and space helmet) that you can't find in other sets.  It's incredibly compact, there's a lot going on in the little frame of this lunar rover!

author: atisf1
title: Great memories
review: This was my first ever Lego set I got from my parents when I was 7. Beautiful times.
